TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SamlSubject extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the subject of a SAML security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify the subject of the security token. The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements. The SAML specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement>. A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement> asserts the principal that is the subject of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token. This principal is specified using a SamlSubject class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.IsReadOnly%2A> property to `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public SamlSubject (string nameFormat, string nameQualifier, string name);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string nameFormat, string nameQualifier, string name) cil managed

Docs.param: A URI reference that represents the format that the `name` parameter is in. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property.
The domain in which the `name` parameter resides. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property.
The subject name. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified name, the domain in which the name resides, and the format the name is in.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the format used to specify a name is extensible, the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.
|Format|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.|

MemberSignature.Value: public SamlSubject (string nameFormat, string nameQualifier, string name, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> confirmations, string confirmationData, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier securityKeyIdentifier);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string nameFormat, string nameQualifier, string name, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> confirmations, string confirmationData, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier securityKeyIdentifier) cil managed

Docs.param: A URI reference that represents the format that the `name` parameter is in. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property.
The domain in which the `name` parameter resides. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property.
The subject name. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property.

An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> of type <xref:System.String> that contains URI references that identify the protocols to authenticate the subject. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ConfirmationMethods%2A> property.
Additional authentication information that can be used by authentication protocols. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.SubjectConfirmationData%2A> property.
A that provides access to a cryptographic key held by the subject of the security token. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified name, the domain in which the name resides, the format the name is in, authentication protocols, additional authentication information, and a key identifier.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The format used to specify a name for the `name` parameter is extensible; the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.
|Format|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.|
The set of authentication protocols to specify for the `confirmations` parameter is extensible; however the following table lists the protocols defined by the SAML specification.
|Protocol|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.HolderOfKey%2A>|A URI that specifies that the recipient of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token should use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.SenderVouches%2A>|A URI that specifies that additional information is not available for a recipient of a SAML security token to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.|

Docs.exception:
contains a or <xref:System.String.Empty> member.
-or-
does not contain any members and is or is <xref:System.String.Empty>.
-or-
does not contain any members and or are not .

Docs.summary: Gets a set of URI references that identify the protocols that should be used to authenticate the subject.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of type <xref:System.String> that contains a set of URI references that identify the protocols that should be used to authenticate the subject.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the set of authentication protocols s extensible, the following table lists the protocols defined by the SAML specification.
|Protocol|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.HolderOfKey%2A>|A URI that specifies that the recipient of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token should use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.SenderVouches%2A>|A URI that specifies that additional information is not available for a recipient of a SAML security token to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.|

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the cryptographic key that is used to verify the digital signature that is identified by this SAML subject statement.
Docs.value: A that contains the cryptographic key that is used to verify the digital signature for a SAML security token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> method is called, the cryptographic key specified in the `<ds:KeyInfo>` element of the digital signature for the SAML security token is used to set the Crypto property. This cryptographic key identifies the subject.
The key identifier for the `<ds:KeyInfo>` element is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1<class System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> ExtractClaims() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a set of claims using the properties of this class.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type that contains the set of claims represented by this instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the ExtractClaims method to get a set of claims associated with the identity of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet ExtractSubjectKeyClaimSet(class System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator samlAuthenticator) cil managed

Docs.param: A that authenticates the portion of a security token that corresponds to the element.
Docs.summary: Gets a set of claims using the properties of this class and the specified SAML security token authenticator.
Docs.returns: A that contains the set of claims represented by this instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the ExtractSubjectKeyClaimSet method to get a set of claims associated with the identity of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
Docs.value: if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a key identifier that provides access to a cryptographic key held by the subject of the SAML security token.
Docs.value: A that provides access to a cryptographic key held by the subject of the security token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The key included in the key identifier that is represented by the KeyIdentifier property is decrypted and set to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Crypto%2A> property when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> method is called.
The KeyIdentifier property corresponds to the `<ds:KeyInfo>` child element of a `<saml:SubjectConfirmation>` element of a SAML assertion.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void MakeReadOnly() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes this instance to be read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the MakeReadOnly method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the subject name of a SAML security token.
Docs.value: The subject name of a security token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property specifies the format that the Name property is in and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property specifies the domain in which the Name property resides in.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property corresponds to the `Format` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

Docs.summary: Gets the claim type that is used to represent the subject name of a SAML security token.
Docs.value: The claim type that is used to represent the subject name of a SAML security token (<xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimTypes.NameIdentifier%2A>).

remarks.format: ## Remarks The NameClaimType returns a claim type for <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a URI reference that represents the format that the subject name of a SAML security token is in.
Docs.value: A URI reference that represents the format that the subject name of a SAML security token is in.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The NameFormat property specifies the format that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property is in.
Although the format used to specify a name is extensible, the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.
|Format|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.|
The NameFormat property corresponds to the `Format` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the domain in which the subject name of a SAML security token resides in.
Docs.value: The domain in which the subject name of a SAML security token resides in.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The NameQualifier property specifies the domain in which the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property resides in.
The NameQualifier property corresponds to the `NameQualifier` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void ReadXml (System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader reader, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer samlSerializer, System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer keyInfoSerializer, System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver outOfBandTokenResolver);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ReadXml(class System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader reader, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer samlSerializer, class System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer keyInfoSerializer, class System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver outOfBandTokenResolver) cil managed

Docs.param: A that is capable of reading XML elements in a SAML assertion.
A that reads the clause of the digital signature.
A that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
Docs.summary: Reads the element from the specified XML reader.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ReadXml method sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ConfirmationMethods%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Crypto%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.SubjectConfirmationData%2A> properties.

Docs.exception:
refers to an XML element in which one of the following is true:
Contains an element without a value.
-or-
Contains an element without a value.
-or-
Contains a element that does not have at least one child element.
-or-
Does not contain at least one or element.
refers to an XML element that contains a element that does not have a key that can be retrieved.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets additional authentication information that can be used by authentication protocols.
Docs.value: Additional authentication information that can be used by authentication protocols.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SubjectConfirmationData property refers to an extensible piece of data that can be customized for a specific authentication protocol.
The SubjectConfirmationData property corresponds to the `<saml:SubjectConfirmationData>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void WriteXml (System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter writer, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer samlSerializer, System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer keyInfoSerializer);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteXml(class System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter writer, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer samlSerializer, class System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer keyInfoSerializer) cil managed

Docs.param: A that is capable of writing XML elements in a SAML assertion.
A that is capable of writing clauses.
Docs.summary: Writes the element into the specified XML serializer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the WriteXml method to write the properties of the current <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> instance into a `<saml:Subject>` element.
